tier.item: (37b) Yohani a-á-oógeje imiduga [néezá] `How do you mean to accompany this student?'
Tswana (Creissels 2004); in addition to data similar to Xhosa, in Tswana wh-words (in
contrast to non-wh-adverbials) may precede the object even without OM:
(37b) Yohani a-á-oógeje imiduga [néezá] `How do you mean to accompany this student?'
Tswana (Creissels 2004); in addition to data similar to Xhosa, in Tswana wh-words (in
contrast to non-wh-adverbials) may precede the object even without OM:
Yohani a-á-oógeje imiduga [néezá] `How do you mean to accompany this student?'
Tswana (Creissels 2004); in addition to data similar to Xhosa, in Tswana wh-words (in
contrast to non-wh-adverbials) may precede the object even without OM:
`I saw him yesterday, this man that is'
`I saw him yesterday, this man that is'
`I saw him yesterday, this man that is'
objects in Xhosa, the interrogative word has to appear immediately adjacent to the verb. (44b) Lorato o apeela MO JARATENG
In such cases the verb must always have objectival agreement through a clitic with the 1.Lorato S3:1-cook-APPL-FIN PREP 9.yard-LOC
object because the object is never adjacent to verbs in questions' (du Plessis and Visser `Lorato does the cooking IN THE YARD'
